file_content.text: The Gormak ship has been destroyed. They shall not reach the stars. You are the one from the vision.
News of your victory preceded you. The entire city is talking of it.
Get out of my sight. I have work to do, making up for your blunder.
You have served the Empire well. When Voss joins the Empire, I will see you recognized for it.
The dark power has a name: Sel-Makor. I fought one of its servants, who claimed to have given Jokull his visions.
I fought a creature that claimed it was the source of Jokull's visions: a servant of a dark power called "Sel-Makor."
This is something the Voss should hear. They've been pestering me endlessly since you left.
My associates have returned as prophesied.
In the Dark Heart, they defeated the creature that sent Jokull his visions.
My associate has returned at last, just as your Mystic said.
Deep inside the Dark Heart, he fought a servant of darkness, which was the source of Jokull's visions.
She met the source of Jokull's power and defeated it.
Thank you for defeating this creature, outsider. We await the wisdom the Mystic foretold.
Your learning will shape Voss's future among the stars.
I'm sure you've discovered something you can tell the Three. Something relevant to the Empire's negotiations, perhaps?
The ancient Jedi conducted experiments on Gormak, and their tampering unleashed the power in the Dark Heart.
Jedi poisoned your world.
Such a crime is unthinkable. Why would the Jedi do us such harm?
Is this how the Gormak learned to construct monstrosities?
We do not know yet that this claim is true.
Speak to your Mystics. Ask them to confirm what my colleague has said. The Jedi have greatly wronged you.
You should cast the Republic out of Voss-Ka. They've lied to you for too long.
The Jedi are your enemies.
Your words require much consideration.
Talk to the Mystics. They must know something about this.
Listen to Darth Serevin.
This is a wise suggestion.
I only say what I learned.
We will ask the Mystics to meditate upon this.
We will halt all talks with the Republic until we know the truth.
You have done all that was asked, outsider. The vision is fulfilled.
The Voss and the Gormak were once the same race. And now something in the Dark Heart feeds on your conflict.
The Voss and Gormak are one.
Impossible! The Voss are not kin to those beasts!
Calm yourself, Gunta-Mer. Perhaps the outsider speaks metaphorically.
No interpretation of such a claim can be true!
My associate only meant that all life on Voss is connected. This is why you must have outsider allies to defeat the Dark Heart.
I do not like this.
I will carry your words to the Mystics. They will guide us.
If you don't stop fighting the Gormak, the Nightmare Lands will spread.
I hope you act on it.
We follow the visions of the Mystics. If they say we must end the war, we will.
You accept that I'm telling you the truth?
Do you believe me, then?
You gain nothing by telling us this tale. You have no reason to lie.
It was worth the risk.
You believe this?
I believe the Mystics. The vision is fulfilled.
We will speak again, Ambassador Serevin. The Mystics will consider what has been said here.
Well done! Blaming the Jedi for the corruption at the Dark Heart was inspired.
I didn't invent a word of it. The Jedi really are responsible for all the trouble here.
I told them the truth.
All the better for us, then! They will cast the Republic off Voss and run to the Empire.
I wish I could be there when the Voss tell the Republic they're halting negotiations.
The Jedi will be furious.
I may have someone from Intelligence sneak in to record the event. It's a moment worth savoring.
Thank you, my lord.
I assure you, I will make your role in this known to those who matter.
You have been awarded a rare honor. Even I have not spoken directly to the Three before.
You have served the Empire well. When I secure Voss, I will do so in your name. The Emperor will be pleased.
I hope that everything goes according to plan, my lord.
I wish you luck.
Don't practice your victory speech yet. Voss seems... unpredictable.
I doubt it will be so easy.
I'm glad to have helped.
Did the Dark Heart erode your wits? You've thrown away any hope of an alliance with Voss, and for what?
They'll be grateful to us for the truth once they've adjusted to the idea.
They'll come around.
Or perhaps the Voss will remain the obstinate, irrational nitwits they've always been.
With the war ended, we can have both Voss Mystics and Gormak technicians join the Empire.
Voss is a bigger prize now.
That's a rosy outcome, if I can smooth things over now that you've offended the Three.
I had my reasons.
You've jeopardized our entire position on this planet. Don't think you've heard the end of this.
Make yourself an obstacle if you want, Serevin. You won't be the first Sith Lord I've crushed underfoot.
Try me.
I don't care if you're Sith; you get in my way, you're dead.
You don't want to cross me.
I did what was necessary. The needs of the Empire are greater than your petty ambition.
Put a sock in it.
I'm leaving Voss.
I've done what was best for Voss and the Empire. It's a pity you don't see that.
I'm sorry you feel that way.
Have you been to see Gehn yet? The idiot Voss are pestering me for news of your progress.
Seek out Murbek Gehn on the edge of the Dark Heart. He may have answers for us.
They say you took this so-called "Gormak king" captive.
The Voss are doubly impressed that you destroyed the ship and killed this "Gormak king."
The fools are entirely convinced you are the agent of their prophesy. Well done, indeed!
So now we wait for the Voss to agree to join the Empire.
Then we just wait.
Our victory is almost at hand.
Sama-Ro said something about "bringing new wisdom."
There's more to the vision.
Which could mean anything--it might even refer to Voss joining the Empire. It's nothing.
It was nothing.
Sama-Ro has already asked for an audience with you.
Emissary, my associates have returned. I believe you were anxious to see them?
The gentleman you wished to speak with has returned, emissary.
Emissary, the lady you wished to speak with has arrived. I wouldn't keep her waiting.
The Three have heard the report of your battle with Jokull. They are troubled. Gormak are not Mystics, they have no visions.
This is the new wisdom the prophesy foretold. It lies in the Dark Heart.
You expect me to find out what gave him his power.
You want me to go there.
It is dangerous. But the Mystics have spoken.
I need more information on this place. Who or what is in there?
What is the Dark Heart?
Most likely, yes.
The Dark Heart is an evil place deep within the Nightmare Lands. We are forbidden to go there.
We do not know what it holds. You must return to us with this knowledge.
Anything for an ally.
I'll search the Dark Heart for answers.
Very well.
Make me an offer.
We understand this is the custom of outsiders. We will pay you for this service.
You have our gratitude.
Well done. One final move, and Voss will be ours.
It won't be simple. Even the most powerful Sith have not made it far into the Dark Heart.
What's kept us from exploring it?
Why not?
I'll succeed with no trouble.
The power of the dark side is overwhelming there. Strong enough that it drives even Sith mad.
With so much riding on my success, I hope you have a plan.
How am I supposed to do this?
Dark Lord Murbek Gehn dwells on the edge of the Dark Heart, studying its power. He alone has managed to withstand the madness.
If anyone knows where to find the source of these visions, he does. Seek him out.
Seek him in the Nightmare Lands. He must know a way for you to defend yourself from the dark power.
Show the Voss that they are destined to join the Empire, and you will be well rewarded.
I've brought you something, my lord. Keln said this writing would prove that the Sith and Jedi had been to Voss before.
Here's what Keln found in the ruins. He said this would prove that the ancient Voss fought the Sith.
The Jedi did find something in those ruins, my lord. Look. He said this writing spoke of an ancient war between the Sith and Voss.
Interesting. Very interesting. I assumed Keln's evidence would be recent. I'll send these to the Sith archive for study.
The Jedi found proof that the Voss once fought the Sith. No one will ever see it now.
Keln found stone tablets proving the Voss once fought the Sith--hard to read in little pieces, though.
Master Keln found tablets in the ruins that spoke of a Voss war against the ancient Sith. The tablets suffered a fatal accident.
The Sith were here before? Our archaeologists have been lazy, it seems. This will be remedied.
You have served the Empire well. I will personally make certain that nothing can be traced to you.
It's not every day you kill a Jedi Master.
I would have liked the credit.
I think you will distinguish yourself here on Voss enough that this one accomplishment won't be missed.
What happens now that Keln is out of the way?
Was he your only threat?
Master Keln was the only one stupid enough to stand in our way. I think we will see some progress now.
That's a relief.
You should be proud; you have utterly crushed the Republic's hope of victory. They will not recover soon.
I bring word.
Emissary! I wasn't expecting you. Do come in.
A Mystic has had a vision concerning outsiders.
Those serving a red banner will keep the Gormak from the stars and bring new wisdom to Voss.
I think we're the outsiders your Mystic spoke of.
We fit that description.
Indeed they are, emissary! The Empire brought them here knowing they were fated to serve Voss.
One who serves a great power will keep the Gormak from the stars and bring new wisdom to Voss.
One who has come seeking silence shall keep the Gormak from the stars and bring new wisdom to Voss.
One who hunts vengeance will keep the Gormak from the stars and bring new wisdom to Voss.
One seeking to illuminate those in the shadows will keep the Gormak from the stars and bring new wisdom to Voss.
One who stands at the right hand of the red man will keep the Gormak from the stars and bring new wisdom to Voss.
I think I'm the outsider you're looking for.
That sounds like me.
Indeed she is, emissary! In fact, we brought her to Voss knowing that she had a destiny to fulfill for your people.
Indeed, emissary, the Empire has known for some time that he is destined to do great things for Voss.
What wisdom? And what's this about the stars?
What does that mean?
That's just gibberish.
Only interpreters can explain a vision. I may only say what I have been told.
A wise course, emissary. Indeed, I believe my associates here are the ones described by the vision.
It is fortunate you came here, emissary. I believe my associate here is the one described.
Then I must report to the Three. There is much to be done.
That was well-played. You had that fool wrapped around your finger.
This is far better than I had anticipated. The gullible fools follow their Mystics without question.
Their naivety can be made to serve us. Fulfill this vision, and it will surely lead them to ally with the Empire.
Where should I start, my lord?
How do I do that?
Yes, my lord.
Excellent. We have much to do.
If you say so.
There is a Voss outpost on the edge of Gorma-Koss. Speak to the commander there.
Make a pilgrimage to the Shrine of Healing. It is a place these idiots revere greatly.
All outsider pilgrims must have Fadith-Ki's permission to enter. Seek him out and get his approval.
Keln is in the Ruined City. Make sure he never leaves it.
Intercept Vesh. Leave no witnesses. The Empire is relying on you.
Strange to see you here. I thought you were reporting to General Rosh at Fort Kodentha.
Eliminate the Houk Syndicate. We cannot let them stand between us and victory.
These charges are grave.
I am bringing the proof with me to Voss, emissary. When you see it, the Three will banish the Empire from the planet.
I'm afraid Jedi Master Keln is mistaken, Emissary Sama-Ro. No such evidence can possibly exist.
I am confident that the Three will find that an alliance with the Empire can only benefit your people.
I await this evidence.
Insufferable idiot.
Ah, you've arrived! It's about time. No doubt you heard some of that.
I take it you have something for me to do, my lord.
You sent for me?
Things aren't going smoothly for the Empire here....
That sounded like trouble.
I could use more info on Voss.
Voss must be brought into the Empire. Their obstinance was a problem before the Jedi began meddling.
We sense a great power here. Strong in the dark side. These people have powers of prophesy we have never seen before.
The Empire must have this world and its secrets, and we know from experience that it cannot be taken by force.
You're trying to woo the Voss into joining the Empire, then.
Which only leaves diplomacy.
It is a delicate balance. We fawn over the arrogant Voss publicly and undercut the Republic's negotiations privately.
So you've already attempted force.
What experience?
That incident has been smoothed over. We held enough executions to ensure that there are no further "mishaps" here.
And now this Jedi Master appears and thinks he can sabotage all we've done!
Shall I get rid of this Jedi?
I could kill him for you.
Your enthusiasm will serve the Empire well.
Does he have specific claims against us?
What has he found?
He remains vague, which he may be using to smoke out our secrets. We must act without detection.
You have a solution, my lord?
How do I help "acquire" it?
Any evidence of misconduct must be erased before this Jedi arrives. Quietly.
A syndicate was hired to steal supplies from the city of Voss-Ka. We then generously offered aid to the people in need.
But the syndicate was made up of Houk: brutish idiots who turned from saboteurs into raiders.
I can see why you wouldn't want this traced back to the Empire.
That could be embarrassing.
Indeed.
I'll make them disappear for you, my lord.
You want this syndicate gone?
Excellent. I knew you would not disappoint me.
They'll pay for this betrayal.
The syndicate's lair is in a cave system. Silence these Houk. Report to General Rosh in Fort Kodentha afterward.
This prophesy is the opportunity we have been waiting for.
I'm done running errands for you, Voss.
Absolutely not. [Refuse quest]
I will relate this to the Three.
An unfortunate decision. We are poised on the edge of victory now. I hope you will reconsider.
I'm not the one the Mystic spoke of. I'm not getting involved.
I can't. [Refuse quest.]
What a waste of talent. Very well, speak to me if you decide you want to take part in the Empire's victory.
No thanks. [Refuse quest]
A pity. We could achieve great things together. Let me know if you reconsider.
Did you find anything else? I will compensate you for anything of value.
I found this. I thought it might still be useful.
Yes. [Hand over the relic]
Ah, excellent! Our people have found nothing of this quality.
All I found in there were Jedi.
No, nothing. [Keep the relic]
Very good. There is probably nothing left in there to trouble us.
Did you find anything else that our incompetent researchers missed?
The ruins were full of Jedi, nothing more, my lord.
No, I didn't.
Very good. There is likely nothing more to find.
Do you think the Sith really came to Voss before?
Do you believe Keln's story?
We have no records of such a thing in the Sith archives; still, it bears consideration.
I can take another look, if you think there's more to find, my lord.
Should I go back and look?
Don't bother. I doubt there's anything to find.
